properties.contents: COLD RAIN and HOWLING WIND batter a vast green field. DENSE FOREST encircles the field. A tree-lined MOUNTAIN RANGE looms large over the forest.
COLD RAIN and HOWLING WIND batter a vast green field. DENSE FOREST encircles the field. A tree-lined MOUNTAIN RANGE looms large over the forest.

Our eyes are glued to the giant, gridded mass of WHITE METAL in front of us, reaching skyward like a hand from the grave--
THE GREEN BANK RADIO TELESCOPE
Taller than the Statue of Liberty. Its gargantuan 300ft-wide REFLECTOR DISH aimed into the black void of space...
...listening.
Our eyes are glued to the giant, gridded mass of WHITE METAL in front of us, reaching skyward like a hand from the grave--
THE GREEN BANK RADIO TELESCOPE
Taller than the Statue of Liberty. Its gargantuan 300ft-wide REFLECTOR DISH aimed into the black void of space...
...listening.

AT THE FOREST’S EDGE
A pair of YELLOW EYES glow in the moonlight-- an EASTERN COYOTE seeking shelter from the storm.
LIGHTNING slams the treeline-- the coyote spooks and scampers off into the night.
AT THE FOREST’S EDGE
A pair of YELLOW EYES glow in the moonlight-- an EASTERN COYOTE seeking shelter from the storm.
LIGHTNING slams the treeline-- the coyote spooks and scampers off into the night.

properties.slug: INT. GREEN BANK OBSERVATORY - CONTROL ROOM - THAT MOMENT

properties.contents:
A wiry astronomer in headphones, GEORGE (32), works at his messy desk. He’s surrounded by a dozen high-def MONITORS and bulky MODULES-- endless buttons and dials in all directions.
OUT THE WINDOW -- a mile out -- the Green Bank Telescope lords over a valley of smaller radio telescopes.
Behind George, HARRY MALUSKY (56), his kindly supervisor, sips his coffee and reads his beloved fishing magazine.
Harry looks up as the screeching winds escalate to a growl.
HARRY says: OK I’m callin’ it. Let’s put her in Survival Mode til the storm passes.
George punches a big yellow button on his switchboard-- the lights on the telescopes POWER DOWN in unison. The field goes BLACK.
Harry throws on his coat to head home for the night.

Harry throws on his coat to head home for the night.

A baby WAAAILING in--
A baby WAAAILING in--

Low thunder outside.
RAIN gently pings off the nursery window.
Low thunder outside.
RAIN gently pings off the nursery window.

An adorable BABY GIRL cries in her crib.
Her sobs slowly soften to a whimper.
The baby lulls herself to sleep.
